result.execSummary:
The defendant James Jared Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: * Restitution payable to ALLSTATE for FOUR THOUSAND NINETY-TWO DOLLARS AND SEVENTY-TWO CENTS ($4,092.72) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
with credit for ONE HUNDRED AND NINETY-TWO (192) DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing 11-02-2016 received and filed. (23 Pages.) CH
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  .

Defendant James Jared Smith in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant James Jared Smith in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of TWO (2) YEARS, with credit for ONE HUNDRED AND NINETY-TWO (192) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE (1) YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is ONE (1) YEAR.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Maintain stable residence.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* Restitution payable to ALLSTATE for FOUR THOUSAND NINETY-TWO DOLLARS AND SEVENTY-TWO CENTS ($4,092.72) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant James Jared Smith in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant James Jared Smith in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

DTC - PHASE I

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  State moved to REVOKE the DTC/DPA.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a factual basis to REVOKE.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 33.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant James Jared Smith in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty AND ORDERED ENTRY OF JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.

For Modification Of Bail.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
